messageBody:
Hi Debio,
There are several ways of grouping your tests, including using suites.
However, the simplest way if you're using Eclipse seems to be like this:
1. Have one folder in your project called "src" for your source code.
2. Have another folder (a sibling of "src") called "junit" or "test" or
something like that. Nowadays I am calling mine "junit" because I've ended
up with a variety of types of test code in my projects.
3. Under the "junit" folder organize your packages the same way as you would
under "src", and keep your test classes and all other related classes here
(such as mock classes).
4 In Eclipse, set up a new run configuration that runs all tests in the
"junit" folder. This will allow you to execute all tests in your project. If
you want to run all the classes in a specific package, you can setup run
configurations to do that also.

As for the Yahoo Groups things - I thought that at first too. But if you go
back into the group there will be a link to Edit Membership, where you can
add a new email address and switch where mail is sent to for this group.

Good luck!
-Dennis
